results.title: Pleiotropic Effects of Simvastatin and Losartan in Preclinical Models of Post-Traumatic Elbow Contracture
results.text_hl: Posteriorly, no strategy provided cartilage protection; in fact, SV strategies worsened the severity of @<m>DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage damage@@@. Note: Histological parameters were semi-quantitatively assessed and given a symbol of either -, +, ++, +++, or ++++, where increases in the number of symbols (+vs. ++++) indicate worse disease severity; details on grading scheme is found in Supplementary Table S1; Control = uninjured, age-matched; INJ = injury no drug; LS-D1 = @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ dosing strategy 1; LS-D2 = @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ dosing strategy 2; SV-D1 = @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ dosing strategy 1; and SV-D2 = @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ dosing strategy 2.

citations.NLM: David MA, Reiter AJ, Dunham CL, Castile RM, Abraham JA, Iannucci LE, Shah ID, Havlioglu N, Chamberlain AM, Lake SP. Pleiotropic Effects of Simvastatin and Losartan in Preclinical Models of Post-Traumatic Elbow Contracture Front Bioeng Biotechnol. 2022;10():803403. PMID: 35265595

results.title: Simvastatin and fluvastatin attenuate trauma-induced cell death and catabolism in human cartilage
results.text_hl: Therefore, we investigated the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@ in a drop-tower-based @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ ex vivo @<m>DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage trauma@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Riegger J, Maurer S, Pulasani S, Brenner RE. Simvastatin and fluvastatin attenuate trauma-induced cell death and catabolism in human cartilage Front Bioeng Biotechnol. 2022;10():965302. PMID: 36159664

results.title: Lipophilic statins prevent matrix metalloproteinase-mediated cartilage collagen breakdown by inhibiting protein geranylgeranylation.
results.text_hl: Cytokine-induced signalling pathway activation was studied by immunoblotting. RESULTS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_mevastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C012258 @@@mevastatin@@@ significantly inhibited @GENE_IL1A @GENE_3552 @@@interleukin 1@@@ (@GENE_IL1A @GENE_3552 @@@IL-1@@@)+oncostatin M (OSM)-induced collagen degradation; this was accompanied with a marked decrease in collagenase and gelatinase activity from @SPECIES_9913 @@@bovine@@@ nasal @<m>DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage@@@.

citations.NLM: Barter MJ, Hui W, Lakey RL, Catterall JB, Cawston TE, Young DA. Lipophilic statins prevent matrix metalloproteinase-mediated cartilage collagen breakdown by inhibiting protein geranylgeranylation. Ann Rheum Dis. 2010 Dec;69(12):2189-98. PMID: 20693272

results.title: Effects of simvastatin, ezetimibe, and their combination on histopathologic alterations caused by adjuvant-induced arthritis.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@, and their combination on histopathologic alterations caused by adjuvant-induced @DISEASE_Arthritis @DISEASE_MESH:D001168 @@@arthritis@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin reduces MMP-3 level in interleukin 1beta stimulated human chondrocyte culture.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our data show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, by blocking @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCoA-reductase@@@ and interfering in the prenylation processes, is able to inhibit @GENE_MMP3 @GENE_4314 @@@MMP-3@@@ production from cultured @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ chondrocytes that have been either unstimulated or stimulated with @GENE_IL1B @GENE_3553 @@@IL1beta@@@, thus suggesting a possible additional mechanism for statins in counteracting chronic @DISEASE_Joint_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007592 @@@joint disease@@@ related @<m>DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage damage@@@.

citations.NLM: Lazzerini PE, Capecchi PL, Nerucci F, Fioravanti A, Chellini F, Piccini M, Bisogno S, Marcolongo R, Laghi Pasini F. Simvastatin reduces MMP-3 level in interleukin 1beta stimulated human chondrocyte culture. Ann Rheum Dis. 2004 Jul;63(7):867-9. PMID: 15194586
citations.BibTeX: @article{15194586, title={Simvastatin reduces MMP-3 level in interleukin 1beta stimulated human chondrocyte culture.}, author={Lazzerini PE and Capecchi PL and Nerucci F and Fioravanti A and Chellini F and Piccini M and Bisogno S and Marcolongo R and Laghi Pasini F}, journal={Ann Rheum Dis}, volume={63}, number={7}, pages={867-9}}

results.title: Simvastatin induces differentiation of rabbit articular chondrocytes via the ERK-1/2 and p38 kinase pathways.
results.text_hl: Some statins, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@), have been shown to have anti-@DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ and anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ effects, reducing @<m>DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage degradation@@@ in osteoarthritic @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@ in vivo.

citations.NLM: Han Y, Kim SJ. Simvastatin induces differentiation of rabbit articular chondrocytes via the ERK-1/2 and p38 kinase pathways. Exp Cell Res. 2016 Aug 15;346(2):198-205. PMID: 27475840
citations.BibTeX: @article{27475840, title={Simvastatin induces differentiation of rabbit articular chondrocytes via the ERK-1/2 and p38 kinase pathways.}, author={Han Y and Kim SJ}, journal={Exp Cell Res}, volume={346}, number={2}, pages={198-205}}

results.title: Mechanically induced experimental knee osteoarthritis benefits from anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory properties of simvastatin via inhibition of matrix metalloproteinase-3
results.text_hl: One of these widely used drugs, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, showed beneficial effects on @DISEASE_Osteoarthritis @DISEASE_MESH:D010003 @@@OA@@@ progression and extent by reducing @<m>DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage degradation@@@ in our experimental setting.

citations.NLM: Aktas E, Sener E, Gocun PU. Mechanically induced experimental knee osteoarthritis benefits from anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory properties of simvastatin via inhibition of matrix metalloproteinase-3 J Orthop Traumatol. 2011 Sep;12(3):145-51. PMID: 21863259
